We have a large house and the Modem is at the other end, so internet signal is weak where it was placed.Between whatever Alexa support did and anything I may have done, it works 100% of the time and even bught another one for the bedroom.No Issues one month later!One of them is on a power bar, so I know you don't need to plug them into an outlet onlyAs for the price, they are on the high side. However, I used to use another brand that required me to log in to their app, get it to work, then hook their app to Alexa.  This is really Plug and Play! One plug, no middleman app.  Just it and Alexa!Going to get more, just waiting for a sale!BTW: Alexa Support are really nice people!!
title: Issue Fixed! Thank You Amazon!  Love my smart Plug

author: Mary
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2019
review_content: I am using this smart plug to turn on and off a lamp that has pull chains .  I have had bad luck with pull chains not lasting, so I try not to use them to turn a lamp on and off .  The Amazon smart plug has taken care of that problem as I can turn my lamp on and off using my phone.  The only downside is that my son gave me a smart plug for Christmas that uses the app Kasa.  Kasa seems to be simpler, as in I can get right to the point of turning the plug on and off.  The Amazon app keeps making me go through two or three steps before I can turn on or off.  That gets irritating after awhile.  Maybe I just don't know how to use the Amazon app. more efficiently.  I don't know .  So this is just my observation after using the two apps for the past 6 weeks or so.
title: Amazon app vs Kasa

author: Michele and Phil
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2019
review_content: I'm quite pleased with this Amazon Smart Plug.  This has to be one of the easiest electronic devices I have set up in ages.  It is so easy that I have no worries about having one sent to my mother for her to use and not having to take it there and set it up myself.The device turns on/of instantly when I make either the verbal request to one of my Alexa devices or use the app on my phone.  It is sized in a way I can still use both outlets at the wall receptacle.I like that I can set up a program for this in the app.In a future update a feature I'd love to see the engineers add would be for me to be able to verbally tell Alexa how long to leave the plug on for.  For example, "Alexa turn on first plug for 20 minutes".
title: I like this plug

author: Chris C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020
review_content: So i bought these now 9 days ago and the moment i received them i connected them and started using them. Now let me tell you initial installation was a breeze, plug it in alex notifies you of a device and voila its connected. Or you could use the 2D barcode supplied with each one to connect it if alexa doesn’t find it immediately.My gripe or issue is with after the fact. After 3 days or so they started to disconnect on their own. No loss of power or internet had occurred. They just stopped responding and became unresponsive. So i started my search on online on why this would occur and this issue now spans 2-3 years almost and Amazon has been able to solve it.I am in IT so all of the typical responses support would give me i did on my own already knowing it. Reset them and then reconnect them and they were connected and started working. 6 hours later they stopped again and just kept blinking Red. I found countless articles telling you different things to do and nothing works they still fail.Amazons responses in all support threads i found was just reset it. I am sorry but i am not going to reset this thing every 3 days when everything else is just working fine all because The issue with these plugs cant be fixed. At $25 each these should be working smoothly without issues. I ordered 5 and now i’m returning them and looking for other means to control things in my house.I would definitely take a look at all of the reviews and not just the positives. Look how far back the negative reviews of these things go and no answer on a permanent fix from Amazon. I would definitely look else where if you want to control lights or anything with plugs before buying these.
title: Not as compatible or smart as they are made to be!

author: MikE
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2020
review_content: If you opt to let amazon store your wifi passwords it's plug and play. My 1st alexa device was this plug and I have not looked back. 4 amazon smart plugs, 2 fire cubes, 2 fire sticks, 1 echo, 2 echo dots, and 3 echo show 5. I've had to buy 5 smart bulbs and 1 outdoor smart plug from 3rd parties though. Hopefully amazon will get in that game as I don't like another app to set them up and then link to alexa. Feel safer with just amazon so make sure you buy devices from reputable companies. I got 2 wyze cams too. Had a foscam get hacked. Great job amazon. Loving this stuff. Learning curve on alexa but I'm getting there. I like learning new stuff and you keep adding more features. Keeping my mind sharp.
title: Plug and Play on existing Amazon Alexa account, I'm on my 4th with no issues

author: Keyur Bhatnagar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2018
review_content: I have a lot of smart devices in my home, Smart bulbs, switches, thermostats, smoke detectors, panels and so on. This is my first smart plug, and I am really impressed with the trigger time of this device with Alexa.I would have give it 4.5 stars if I had an option, as I have both Alexa and Google Home and this smart plug will only work with Alexa.Quality of the plug is pretty good and the pairing was super east. Infact I just plugged it and my Echo announced that it has found and paired it.I am very happy with the plug, I got it in the Echo Dot + Smart Plug deal but I am ok to invest full price to it.
title: My first smart plug

author: Iowacalling
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2019
review_content: Nice design; compact and stable in the outlet. However, that is eclipsed by Amazon's poor integration. During setup, Amazon forces the user to turn on location services. WHY? The plug isn't travelling...it's stuck in the outlet.  This seems like another cynical attempt to gather information customers.Back to Amazon's poor integration with this product... during setup Alexa asks the user to scan a code included with the plug.  No problem, except the app can't find the code. Amazon allows for setup with the familiar process used to enable other products like TP-Link or Philips so it eventually gets done.  Once setup, it works within the Alexa app on the Fire tablet used to set it up but nothing else.  None of the six Echo devices (Dot, Show, or Plus) can find the plug.  Amazon should be able to do better.
title: Sorry, I can't find a device named...

author: Urban Writer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2018
review_content: The best thing??? All I had to do is plug it in and the plug was immediately recognized by Alexa and added to smart plug section of smart house in the Alexa app. I didn't have to try to get it connected and call customer support as I did with the WeMo smart plug that eventually stopped working with Alexa. I've already brought 2 and plan to buy more! Great product. Thinking about getting the microwave for my garage. If you are listening Amazon...please make your microwave in different colors. Red please or silver. Thanks. Lets tackle the kitchen! Amazon Coffee Maker would be nice.
title: Awesome product. Connects automatically

author: Latindoll
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020
review_content: Nobody tells you that you have to download all the apps (if they have one) to your electronics, appliances, etc's that works with Alexa in your home in order for this plug to work. You also will need a plug for each item you want to use it for. I can only use this plug  for my TV and all it does is shut if off and on because if I want it to do more I have to have the app for the brand of TV (which they don't) I have and of course pay a monthly fee. So imagine paying fees for multiple items monthly and buying a plug for each of them. Also since my TV brand doesn't have an app for Alexa use, when I ask her to turn off the TV, I have to say "Turn off plug one". I hope this post helps.
title: Expected more...

author: Uly Pittman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2020
review_content: If you are not looking to set up a routine or a schedule, you have to set up a sleep timer on the plug by saying "Alexa, set a sleep timer on ____(plug name)____ for _____ minutes/hours".  The plug will power off when the sleep timer is finished without any alarm or further notification.  Make sure Alexa confirms that she will turn the plug off after the amount time you specified otherwise you may get a regular timer with an alarm telling you the timer is up.  If that happens, the plug will not power off.  Also make sure to use a simple name for the plug such as "plug" or "car" because mine would not respond to the word "distiller" which is what I was using it for.
title: TIMER ADVICE HERE - MUST USE SLEEP TIMER FOR COUNTDOWN

author: derf
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2018
review_content: These plugs are easy to install and work very well. My only criticism is that they don't come in brown or black. Or, for that matter, why not have them in other colors as well, just like the Echo? The white is so conspicuous when most extension cords, power strips, etc. come in brown or black. I realize it's a small criticism. But, the other smart plugs that come in black all seem to be glitchy. Come on, Amazon, it's a simple thing, right?
title: Love it except why not in brown or black?

author: richard quivera
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2018
review_content: es sencillo de los 3 artefacto el único que no me causó dificultad en acoplarse fue este. funciona bien y su acabado futuristico
title: facil al cuadrado de acoplar

author: Joseph Moser
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2020
review_content: Plug worked great for 2 days. Connected easily worked flawlessly until it didn’t. So that being said I think I know how to connect one.When it started to say unresponsive I did the whole reset my internet than the plug. Still connects but unresponsive. So I called Amazon which is no easy task.  Nice person on the phone but probably as clueless as I am says she will send me a new one. Okay cool I thought since I actually had a second one here anyway (this is meant to control my Christmas tree and all of this aggravation is so I can say Alexa Merry Christmas and the tree lights up). So figuring I had a defective unit I hung up and proceeded to connect new plug. Well can you believe it same thing unresponsive. Awesome I thought if only I could call technical support maybe I could work through problem. See not first time with these not so smart doo dads. Seems they all have some trick to them. I am pretty sure at this point they will all be going back. Good thing is I only paid 5 bucks. Then again you get what you pay for I guess.
title: Unresponsive Doo Dads

author: Afa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2020
review_content: The reason for my three-star review is the size of this plug. It's just ridiculous for being a single plug. Other than that it works fine most of the time. I've had it for about a year and I've lost Wi-Fi single twice, which wasn't really a big deal I just unplugged it and plugged it back in. The size tho. I only got this plug because it was a deal with an Amazon echo Dot. There's much better options out there. I even got a power surge protector power strip that has individual plugs that respond to smart actions. Now that's nice and was about the same price as this thing if I were to buy it separately and the strip has 12 plugs and three USB's. There's also smaller single plugs that are round rather than rectangle.
title: Works, but very bulky for a single plug. There's better options out there.

author: RODNEY SMITH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2020
review_content: I used the smart plug in my master bedroom to control the primary lamp that is control by a switch. My issue is my youngest son @ 5 years old keeps turning the light switch off as he leaves the room and sometimes on before speaking to Alexa. This disruption causes havoc with the smart plug and our simple request to turn in light.I’ve found the only simply way is to make the a more specific request such as “Alexa turn on master bedroom lamp “. I get the reply OK but no light. I then make my 2Nd request Alexa turn on light. Then the smart plug turns blue and the light comes on. The smart plug is reprogrammed.If there were an easier way to reactivate the smart plug once the primary wall switch is turn back to the in position I would be delighted. Or a simpler added rubber stop that can be added to the wall switch that keeps it in the on position to help train all family members that this is a smart switch in conjunction with a smart plug. Hope a designer is out there reading this as it’s a real simple addition to the typical switch. Otherwise I love the smart plug and intend to purchase many more for various uses within my home.
title: Great smart plug but Need a Smart Switch more!

author: Quadt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2020
review_content: I bought three of these and put them on a shelf.  I took them out to use today for the first time.  They cannot maintain solid wifi connection.  There are may others out there experiencing the same issue.  I've had training in wireless and have tried everything possible in my "tool kit" to resolve this intermittent loss of connectivity.... 2.4ghz only, increasing broadcast power, decreasing broadcast power, mixed mode, different locations, different ssid's and passwords, different bit-rates). Of course I bought these over a year ago and now they are out of support.  Note to self never buy and assume they will work.  FYI... I own a few TP-Link outlets - they work 100%.
title: Junk!

author: D. White
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
review_content: Just received my Smart Plug a few days ago and so far it's working fine.  I have it set up in my kitchen, on the counter to turn the lights on and off.  My son set it up on my tablet also, so that I can turn the lights on and off from anywhere in the house.  I have just the one Smart Plug to see how practical, and reliable it is, before considering buying another.  The fact that I can turn on the lights before I enter the kitchen is, in my opinion, a good thing, practical and reliable. I also like the way that Alexa always says. "Ok" when I give her a command.  For me, it's an extra assurance that she heard me and that she's following through with my command.  My conclusion; So Far, So Good
title: So Far, So Good - Reliable and Practical

author: Ima Gardner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019
review_content: This is suppose to be so easy to use.  I have spent hours unable to connect this to my WiFi. Every time I try to connect to my password protected WiFi, it says that my WiFi does NOT require a password then the whole process fails with a “Provisioning Error”.  I found a very long discussion on AmazonForum.com starting in 2018 until now about this same problem.  I am not about to try deleting and reinstalling my Alexa app, sitting on their costumer service line or all the other lengthy things suggested since most say it does not resolve the problem.  This is just not worth it.  I can still turn on a light without Alexa.  I planned to give these as Christmas gifts after trying one but no way.  It’s going back tomorrow.  VERY DISAPPOINTED.
title: Provisioning Failure cannot connect to Wifi

author: CollinsClan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020
review_content: I only bought this because it was on sale.I never thought I would actually appreciate it.We simply used it on one livingroom light.I can't see in the dark, at all.I can now leave that light on, go to bed, then from the comfort and safety (as in my toes aren't hitting anything), I can turn off the livingroom light.OR, if we are out later than we expect, I can have the light turned on.Our house is pitchblack, it's 9pm, and we won't be home for another hour.. no worries. Just from my Alexa app on my phone, I turn on the light. Feels a little safer and I'm not stumbling in the dark to get to the nearest light switch.
title: Never thought I'd appreciate this...

author: Gee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
review_content: It took a couple of tries before I got this connected, only because I didn't quite understand how to set it to my wi-fi -- I realized right off that I needed to use my camera's lens to view the "bar code" to identify the device first. Doing that, it connected easily. It's on a lamp, but it'll be so much easier controlling the Christmas tree lights by voice command, rather than crawling under the tree -- or clapping! I haven't used tech support, but don't imagine I'll have difficulty.
title: So much more fun than "Clap On! Clap Off!"

author: John Gaston
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
review_content: I thought for quite some time how I would use one of these devices.  I finally pulled the trigger and have used it on various things around the house. A light, the Christmas tree, a space heater, etc. I am getting more and more impressed with how well and useful these voice controlled devices can be.  I am feeling the urge to purchase more of them. This particular Amazon branded model works very well and if it can handle a space heater it should work for anything else around the house. I would like to see Amazon market one of these that is outdoor rated. All kinds of possibilities out in the yard. So I think I am sold on these and would recommend this device.
title: Neat Technology

author: thoughtwing
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020
review_content: We use the device for home use and to trigger indoor security lighting for when we're away from the household.  Four adults (parents/2 adult children) live on site, four cell phones.  Device installs on account holder's phone.  Cannot reside on the four phones, just one.  Such being the case, has limited practical security use for residents going and coming to empty house.  The device works fine, some complications when engaged by respective resident's echos, but resolvable.  Also rated at 15amp, which means you can start your coffee or crock pot remotely.  Really, to best serve the household, device should have the capacity to work the same for all residents under one identified household group.
title: Works well up to a point.

author: Blondish
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2020
review_content: Initially, I loved this plug. It let me control the lights easily without getting off the couch, or when I was away from home. It has been less than a year, and this plug has suddenly stopped working. It will no longer connect to the WiFi, and while I was finally able to get it set up on the app again after multiple troubleshooting solutions, it became “unresponsive” almost immediately — literally within a few seconds of the app telling me the device was connected. This plug wasn’t even working 100% previously, I still needed to restart it every once in awhile, but now it’s just an expensive piece of trash. My next try will be with another brand (and for less money!)
title: Expensive outlet ornament, not much else

author: Peter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2018
review_content: So easy to set-up!  Whether you are using the provided QR code in the packaging, or pushing the button on the plug, it easily pairs with the app and is ready to take commands.  I really like that I can add it to skills & routines.  The plug is the full width of an outlet faceplate, so do be aware of the size when you are thinking about where to put it.It would be pretty cool if Amazon came up with an actual GFCI outlet that installs as a normal one does =)
title: Alexa, Thank You

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2019
review_content: I don't know what's wrong with Amazon's smart plugs but they are not dependable. Always having to reset the thing. Works most of the time with Alexa when its powered on. It keeps shutting off for some reason. I replaced it with a different brand and connected it to Alexa and have had no more issues. This tells me that it's the Amazon plug that is the problem. One would think that the Amazon plugs would be best to work along with Alexa, but not so.
title: Inconsistent, so I replaced it with a different brand.

author: Darwin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019
review_content: I debated for a long while on smart plugs for various Christmas decorations.  After deciding to go with the amazon smart plug I have had no real issues with them.  They work so long as they have a wifi signal. The only time I've had an issue with them is when the range extender they were connect to failed.  Not a problem with the plug by any means. I do wish that the Alexa app would notify you when they are offline but all in all I'm very happy with them and glad I do not have to introduce another app to control my environment.My only side thought on this,Dear Amazon,Get off your butts and make an outdoor version!Thanks-D
title: Awesome for Christmas Lights

author: Jessica D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2020
review_content: I had zero interest in purchasing a smart plug.  I don't need to turn my TV on and off using my voice, my light switches worked just fine, and I had timers on my lamps.  But when I was able to pick this up for .99, I figured why not try it out.  I put this on a lamp in the living room that is behind the couch.  It was on a timer, but when we would lose power, the timer would get all messed up and I would have to pull the couch out to adjust it.  Or when it gets darker earlier/later, I was always having to adjust the time.  Now that I have this plug on that lamp, I don't have to worry about it!  I just tell Alexa to turn on the living room light, and it's done.  I can leave the light on in the morning when it's dark so my dog isn't alone in the dark, and then turn the light off when I get to work and it's lighter out by using the app.  It was incredibly easy to set up and Alexa connected with no issues.
title: Convenient!

author: Njsyd
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2019
review_content: If I could give this a zero, I would. 2 hours of trying everything auto and manually. This will not connect to my Xfinity WiFi.  My Bluetooth connected and that’s it.  I wasted enough time. I will go back to Phillips Hue  bulbs. They interface well.Ipdate:  finally got this to work. Needs 2.4 ghz  WiFi connection. xfinity gateway connects to 5 automatically.  Changed my xfinity WiFi to two different names. One for 2.4 snd one for 5.  Had to connect phone to 2.4 to use Alexa app to set plug. Worked like a charm.
title: Finally figured out how to connect to my Xfinity WiFi

author: Laura D'Amore
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020
review_content: This plug is amazing with it's built in intelligence and automatic link to Alexa.  The set up could not have been easier!!! Straight out of the box, I plugged the Amazon Smart Plug into the wall, turned on the lamp and then plugged it into the smart plug, asked Alexa to turn on the lights and instantly Alexa knew what to do.  She guided me with a few very basic questions (like what did I want to name the plug?...lights....and what room were they in?...living room).  She then said OK you're all set.  I would highly recommend this plug and look forward to purchasing more.  Thank you Amazon for creating simple to use products that make me feel like a genius!!
title: Super Simple Set Up!

author: Montero
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2020
review_content: I was so excited to get this plug and it was working beautifully for about three weeks and just gave out and would not connect to Alexa.  I contacted Amazon and got a replacement almost as soon as the next day. I have had my new one for about three weeks again and it started turning off and on again. It's been fine for a day but I a worried it will break too. When it works i am so happy and it makes life just a bit more enjoyable. Just in case when it does fail to start there is a button on the side that makes it a manual on and off button. The only reason I didnt give this item three stars is because it has failed on me once and I'm thinking it will do so again. For being as expensive as it is at regular price $24-$25 I was not too happy.
title: Has had issues but when it works life is great!!

author: jlmontag
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2018
review_content: I bought one as an add-on to an Echo Dot just to see how it works.  Right out of the box it boots up, finds the Echo, logs on to my home network, and is ready to go.  I plug in a strand of Christmas lights, create a group, and start controlling with my voice.  I am now 3 minutes in and love not having to plug things in when I want them to work.  As soon as they went on sale I ordered two more and all my Christmas lights (including tree) became voice activated.  Endless potential here, and the operation and setup are seamless if you already have an echo in the house.  Once Christmas is over, they are going to be deployed to various lamps and maybe a coffee pot.  I'll probably end up buying at least 5 more...
title: Addicted to making my home smart

author: Bob
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2019
review_content: I bought these to replace mechanical timers for lamps. Rather than setting them to come on and go off at a specific time I set up a routine to turn ON at sunset and OFF at dawn.Out of 6 "smart" plugs only 2 run the routine. The other 4 refuse. 2 ran the routine just long enough to get past the 30 day return window. The remaining 2 refused to run the routine out of the box.There are some serious programming problems that need to be addressed.Today received replacements for 2 plugs that did not run the routine. These plugs were DOA. They don't run the routine. Only work manually using the Alexa app.What good is that?These plugs are not smart. They are actually pretty dumb.
title: STILL Unreliable

author: Jane Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2019
review_content: This plug works very well and is an excellent value.  It was easy to set up, and we've purchased several for convenience, safety, and security.  For convenience - in spots that are a hassle to get to (Christmas lights are a good example.)  For safety - because now we can always check if we left the iron on.  And for security - so we can control lights when we are away, such as on vacation, to make it look as though someone is home.Our wifi didn't send a strong signal to some parts of our home, so devices in those areas would go offline, including the smart plugs.  We have added a wifi extender, so now there is strong signal throughout the house, and none of the smart plugs go offline anymore.
title: great addition for smart home, excellent value; may need wifi extender if wifi in home is weak

author: Jerry Y.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2020
review_content: I have a desktop chrome box computer with an Alexa/Echo app installed.  I've had an Echo device for years which works great.  Now decided to purchase an Amzon smart plug since they had such a good sale price for a couple of days.  Link this device to your Amazon account to enable Wi-Fi Simple Setup.If you already have a qualifying Amazon device in your home that is connected to your Wi-Fi network, the new device can automatically connect to your home Wi-Fi network and complete setup.  That is what worked very easily for me.  And the plug does work great.  Very handy device even though we only use it to turn a light off and on.  No complaints!
title: Easy and simple to install
